title: How do I enable Python on IDA 6.8?
content:
I have a python dir within IDA 6.8 folder with idaapi.py, idautils.py, and idc.py. IDA doesn't seem to pick the Python scripting by default.

How do I enable it?

comments.text: IDA 6.8 was released in 2014 -- 8 years ago. Have you considered upgrading to a more recent version?
Are you talking about Python 2 or 3? The capability to use Python 3 was introduced in one of the 7.x versions (could be 7.2 not sure about this).
@Robert For 6.8 it uses Python 2.7. It even has an installer for it with the distribution. Not helping to setting it up though...

@RolfRolles I just didn't want to disturb my current setup. Since I was doing it over the years and I am not sure I needed any new features until now, which is not that new either as Python support was there for a while.

answers_data.content:
Fixed it with the help of this page

At the end of the day it was
